intro: Linaria schelkownikowii, commonly known as the Schelkownik's toadflax, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the genus Linaria in the family Plantaginaceae, characterized by its showy, often yellow or orange flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and thrives in sunny, arid environments. Its slender stems and lance-shaped leaves are adapted to withstand harsh climatic conditions. Linaria schelkownikowii is noted for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its vibrant floral display.
